name: Christopher Columbus
what_did:
Columbus sailed across the Atlantic Ocean in 1492, trying to find a new route to Asia.
Instead, he reached the Americas — lands unknown to Europeans at the time.
He made four trips and helped open up the New World to Europe.
why_matters:
Columbus’s voyages changed history by connecting Europe and the Americas.
This led to big changes in trade, cultures, and world exploration.
Some people honor him as a bold explorer, while others remember the harm that followed.

questions.q: What was Columbus trying to find?
How many trips did Columbus make?

options: He connected Europe and the Americas

fun_fact: Columbus called the people he met 'Indians' — he thought he had reached Asia!
